required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Early Extubation and Postoperative Complications After Liver Transplantation
clinical_study.official_title: Association Between Early Extubation and Postoperative Complications After Liver Transplantation: A Retrospective Propensity Score-matched Analysis

brief_summary.textblock: This is a retrospective cohort study. Patients who underwent liver transplantation from January 1, 2016 to December 30, 2019 were admitted to the study and divided into two groups. Early extubation group: early extubation (EE) in the operating room immediately following liver transplantation. Delay extubation: delay extubation (DE) in the intensive care unit following liver transplantation. The primary objectives were to compare the incidence of moderate to severe postoperative complications between the EE and DE groups. The secondary objectives were to compare outcomes such as intensive care unit (ICU) length of stay, hospital length of stay, and total cost between the EE and DE groups.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients who underwent liver transplantation from January 1, 2016 to December 30, 2019 were admitted to the study. Inclusion criteria: (1) adult patients (age ≥ 18 years), (2) undergoing liver transplantation, (3) admitted to the intensive care unit (ICU). Exclusion criteria were the following: (1) Re-transplantation; (2) Multiorgan transplants; (3) Intraoperative deaths ;(4) Leaving hospital within 48 hours; (5)Incomplete clinical data. The primary objectives was the number of patients in-hospital moderate to severe postoperative complications. Complications were defined and graded as mild, moderate, or severe as described by European Perioperative Clinical Outcome definitions and were included if they occurred in hospital after surgery. The secondary objectives were 30 Days all-cause mortality, hospital length of stay, ICU length of stay, total hospital cost, the incidence of re-admissions, re-intubation and reoperations.

primary_outcome.measure: The incidence of postoperative moderate to severe complications
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Complications were defined and graded as mild, moderate, or severe as described by European Perioperative Clinical Outcome definitions and were included if they occurred in hospital after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence of 30 Days all-cause mortality.
secondary_outcome.description: Mortality is defined as death for any cause within 30 days
Re-admission after discharge of an initial stay during 30 days
Medical Definition of reoperation. : an operation to correct a condition not corrected by a previous operation or to correct the complications of a previous operation.
Reintubation was defined as intubation after extubation of a patient who had been initially tracheal intubated under general anaesthesia

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Length of hospital stay is the duration of a single episode of hospitalization

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Length of ICU stay is the duration of a single episode of ICU hospitalization

arm_group.description: extubation (EE) in the operating room immediately following liver transplantation
extubation (DE) in the ICU following liver transplantation

intervention.description: Patients who underwent liver transplantation early extubation (EE) in the operating room immediately following liver transplantation
Patients who underwent liver transplantation delay extubation (DE) in the ICU following liver transplantation

study_pop.textblock: Patients who underwent liver transplantation from January 1, 2016 to December 30, 2019 were admitted to the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients (age ≥ 18 years)
- Undergoing liver transplantation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Re-transplantation
- Multi-organ transplants
- Intra-operative deaths
- severe encephalopathy (West Haven criteria III or IV)
- patients who had preoperative mechanical ventilation or fulminant hepatic failure
- Incomplete clinical data
